alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Carbon; Park; Stillwater; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 16 at 12:54PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Warmest Temperatures of the season will lead to rising river levels again late this weekend... The warmest temperatures of the season are expected Friday and Saturday, and will enhance snowmelt in the mountains producing another increase of flows on area waterways this weekend. Isolated to scattered showers and thunderstorms Saturday and Sunday may also add additional water locally. Many waterways could reach close to bankfull by Saturday afternoon or Sunday with minor flooding possible. However, this is not expected to compare at all to the recent serious flooding in the area earlier this week and should be comparable to more typical run-off we see this time of year. Smaller streams will see the greatest rises, and stream conditions may see sudden changes which could present difficulties for those recreating in the foothills. Unpaved roads may suddenly be covered in water, becoming muddy and impassable. The severity of the impacts will be very sensitive to just how warm we get as well as how warm the overnight lows are. Currently, highs in the 70s in the mountains are forecast with lows in the 40s. Cooler temperatures are expected earlier next week which will help slow the snowmelt. All persons in the mountains and foothills this weekend should be prepared for changing conditions and use extreme caution when near waterways. Flows will be fast, and the water is cold. Stay tuned to the forecast for the latest temperature and precipitation trends, along with any warnings or advisories that may be issued. Please report any flooding to local law enforcement and have them relay the report to the National Weather Service.
